name: The Perfect Game
description: Based on a true story, a group of boys from Monterrey, Mexico who became the first non-U.S. team to win the Little League World Series.

review.author: intelearts
review.heading: 432rd Review: Excellent Inspitatonal Sports Movie - not just for kids!
review.reviewBody:
This dramatization of the 1957 World Little League Champions is just a terrific watch - sure, it is a little clich√©d in places - but what sports movie isn't, but it has the same vibe as The Mighty Ducks and The Bad News Bears except that is based on a true story.

All in all, baseball films are nearly always good to watch, and this is no exception - the team is fun, the story is built well, the film is nicely edited, you get a ton of baseball, and the moral compass is firmly fixed to good throughout.

One of the better sports films for kids - and adults - and one that deserves a wide audience.
